ygData.messageBody:
It doesn't work anymore. Now if you give a NO DROP item to a mob, it will
take it, but it won't be there after you killed it. If you want to test it,
make a new char and you will have 5 NO DROP food and 5 NO DROP water. Try
to give them to rats and snakes and see if you can get any back.

Here is another warning about NO DROP item. If you have a NO DROP item
inside a backpack when you died, make sure you have space in your inventory
before you loot the backpack. A normal backpack will drop to the ground if
you don't have enough space, but a backpack with a NO DROP item will
***DISAPPEAR*** if you try to loot it and you don't have room.

>The only solution around this, as was suggested by someone else on this
>list, is to give the item to a mob and then kill the mob to loot the item.
>You can give NO DROP items to NPC's because of the need to be able to do so
>for quests.
>
>LORE items I understand, the NO DROP items have gotten a little carried
>away. BurnedOut Lightstones for example. Why can't I give those away to
>someone? They're not a quest, they're not valuable loot, what the hey?
>
